description: President Donald Trump says he has approved a plan for the US Navy to begin the construction of two new battleships. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Announces Plan to Build New Navy Battleships

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump announced he’ll meet next week with executives from major US defense contractors in a bid to force them to spend more money on weapons development, not stock buybacks, executive pay and dividends.
title: Trump to Host Defense Firms to Urge Less Spending on Buybacks

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: A mistrial was declared in the case of a former top aide to New York governors Kathy Hochul and Andrew Cuomo accused of acting as an unregistered foreign agent for China in exchange for millions of dollars in kickbacks.
title: Mistrial Declared for Ex-Hochul Aide Accused of Acting for China

author: Jen Judson, Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump announced the US Navy will build a new “Trump-class” warship as part of the White House push to modernize the service’s surface fleet and restore domestic shipbuilding.
title: Trump Unveils Warship Named After Himself in Shipbuilding Push

author: Sherif Tarek
description: Fresh clashes between the Syrian army and a US-backed group erupted Monday in northern Syria, further diminishing hopes to meet a year-end deadline to integrate the armed faction into state institutions.
title: Syrian Army, US-Backed Group Clash Before Integration Deadline

author: Nathan R Dean
description: Congressional action will be incremental, but geopolitics will continue to make news.
title: What to Watch for in Washington as We Usher In 2026

description:
On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostic discuss the S&P 500's moves as a holiday-shortened trading week begins, and traders begin positioning for 2026.
Glenmede Chief of Investment Strategy & Research Jason Pride joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, NerdWallet Senior Economist Elizabeth Renter talks inflation, affordability, and the labor market. Plus, Kayak CEO Steve Hafner on the holiday travel forecast and the rollout of a new AI mode for planning and booking. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Miran Warns Fed Risks Recession Without More Cuts | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/22/2025

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: A court in Guayaquil found Ecuadorian air force members guilty of the enforced disappearance of four youths a year ago, sentencing most to nearly 35 years in jail.
title: Ecuador Sentences Soldiers to 35 Years in Killing of Four Boys

author: Mackenzie Hawkins, Andy Lin (News), Kari Soo Lindberg
description: Singapore-based Megaspeed has imported tens of thousands more chips than Nvidia saw when checking its data centers.
title: Nvidia’s Biggest Southeast Asian Partner Dogged by China Chip Smuggling Questions

description: Larry Ellison is throwing his personal fortune behind Paramount Skydance Corp.’s bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., agreeing to provide an irrevocable personal guarantee of $40.4 billion in equity financing for the offer and any damages claims against Paramount. Paramount also offered to increase its regulatory reverse termination fee to $5.8 billion from $5 billion. Warner Bros. would have to pay $2.8 billion to Netflix if it backs out of its deal and goes with another suitor, according to terms of the agreement. Bloomberg's Chris Palmeri joined Caroline Hyde and Romaine Bostick on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Larry Ellison Backs Paramount's WBD Offer with $40B Guarantee

author: Jimmy Jenkins, Zoe Tillman
description: Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia will remain free at least through the end of the month after a federal judge sought more information on whether the US plans to detain or deport him again.
title: Abrego Garcia Can Remain Free at Least Through End of the Month

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: The US Federal Communications Commission said it would ban most foreign-made drones and and critical components for unmanned aircraft systems going forward, a day ahead of a deadline for adding Chinese drone-maker SZ DJI Technology Co. to the agency’s so-called covered entity list.
title: No More New Foreign Drones to Be Allowed in US Under FCC Rules

author: Eric Martin, Courtney McBride
description: The Trump administration has ordered dozens of US ambassadors to step down, people familiar with the matter said, a precedent-breaking recall that will leave embassies abroad without Senate-confirmed leadership.
title: Trump Recalls Dozens of Career Ambassadors From Around the World

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: More than a dozen staffers departed the Heritage Foundation over the weekend to join a rival organization, the latest sign of ideological tumult at the think tank once considered the central node in Washington’s conservative ecosystem and an intellectual bastion for President Donald Trump.
title: Heritage Foundation Suffers Defections as MAGA Tensions Grow

description: Elizabeth Renter, senior economist at NerdWallet, says that there are real reasons people are feeling negative while the economy is doing 'okay,' including that households aren't as economically resilient to financial stress as they were five years ago as the public deals with high housing and energy prices and a slowing job market.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Households Have 'Real Reasons' to Feel Bad About Economy, Says Elizabeth Renter

description: Kayak Co-Founder & CEO Steve Hafner joined Romaine Bostick and Caroline Hyde on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the holiday travel outlook, prices pulling back despite a surge in travel demand, and the launch of a new AI mode to help with booking and planning.   (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Travel Demand Up, Fares Down, Says Kayak CEO

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the US pursuit of a third oil tanker intensifying the Venezuela blockade. On today's show, Director of the Energy Security and Climate Change Program at the Center for Strategic and International Studies Joseph Majkut, Democracy Visiting Fellow at Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, and Policy Director at Brownstein Hyatt Farber Schreck Greta Joynes. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Tanker Pursuit Intensifying Venezuela Blockade | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/22/2025

description: Joseph Majkut of the Center for Strategic and International Studies says developers of AI data centers will have to factor in building their own power supply as the public grows more concerned the drain on resources. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Data Center Developers Will Need To Bring 'Own Power,' Says Energy Expert

author: Kate Sullivan, Dan Williams, Donato Paolo Mancini, Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US and its allies are renewing their push to hold a conference on Gaza reconstruction, people familiar with the matter said, as the Trump administration looks to inject fresh momentum into a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas after a string of setbacks.
title: US Weighs Conference to Rebuild Gaza in Fresh Ceasefire Push

description: Bloomberg's Nick Wadhams breaks down the state of the Trump administration's blockade off the coast of Venezuela as the Coast Guard chases down a non-sanction oil tanker in the area. It marks the third vessel the US has targeted. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Pursuit of Third Oil Tanker Deepens Venezuela Blockade

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump administration is offering undocumented migrants $3,000 and paid travel if they agree to leave the US voluntarily before the end of the year, its latest effort to escalate mass deportations and slash enforcement costs.
title: Trump Team Triples Bonus to $3,000 for Migrants Who Self-Deport

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney named former BlackRock Inc. executive Mark Wiseman as Canada’s ambassador to the US, tapping an experienced investment manager to handle relations with the Trump administration ahead of major trade talks.
title: Carney Taps Ex-BlackRock Executive Wiseman as Canada’s US Ambassador

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: George Conway, a prominent critic of President Donald Trump, filed to run for the House of Representatives to replace retiring Representative Jerry Nadler in a New York City district that spans much of Manhattan.
title: George Conway to Run as a Democrat for Nadler’s Manhattan Seat

author: Jen Judson
description: The US Navy announced plans to build a new class of warship as part of President Donald Trump’s “Golden Fleet” bid to revive US shipbuilding and address shortfalls in smaller ships exposed by recent military operations around the world.
title: US Unveils Plans for New Ship Under Trump’s ‘Golden Fleet’ Bid

author: Michael Smith, Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s former lawmaker Eduardo Bolsonaro, who moved to the US in March seeking White House support to avert the arrest of his father Jair Bolsonaro, has had both of his Brazilian passports canceled at least since the beginning of the month, according to government officials.
title: Eduardo Bolsonaro Loses Both Brazil Passports Amid Court Probe

description: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said the US central bank risks sparking a recession unless it continues lowering interest rates next year. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed's Miran Says Recession Risks Rise Without More Rate Cuts

author: Courtney McBride
description: A US campaign that has involved deadly strikes against alleged drug-trafficking vessels and intercepts of oil tankers carrying Venezuelan crude is meant to deter illicit activity and to signal that the US wants Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro out of power, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said.
title: US Says Boat Strikes, Blockade Signal Venezuela’s Maduro ‘Needs to Be Gone’

description: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said the US central bank risks sparking a recession unless it continues lowering interest rates next year. “If we don’t adjust policy down, then I think that we do run risks,” Miran said on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Recession Risks Rise Without More Rate Cuts, Miran Says

description: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran says he hasn't decided yet if he'll vote for a 25 or 50 basis point interest rate cut at the next meeting. Miran, whose term at the Fed ends in January, has argued for larger cuts since he joined the Board of Governors in September. “You sort of get into territory where you can start micromanaging instead of big cuts,” the Fed governor said. “And I don’t know whether we’re here yet, or it would sort of still take a couple more cuts to get there.”  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed's Miran Hasn't Decided on What Size of Next Rate Cut Should Be

author: Eric Laperozy
description: Russia has sent arms to Madagascar’s military government, which assumed power in an October coup.
title: Russia Sends Arms Shipment to Madagascar’s Military Government

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: A South African court rejected a 54 billion-rand ($3.2 billion) settlement between the nation’s energy regulator and electricity provider over a tariff-calculation mistake that would have seen power prices raised by more than previously permitted, Moneyweb reported.
title: South Africa Court Rejected a $3.2 Billion Eskom Tariff Deal, MNY Says

author: Will Wade, Kellie Lunney
description: The Trump administration is suspending leases to five wind farms under construction off the US East coast over national security concerns, the latest move in the government’s broad assault on renewable energy.
title: US Suspends Offshore Wind Leases, Citing National Security

author: Oscar Medina
description: The Colombian government is attempting to ram through a fiscal plan by decree after it was rejected by the legislature, pushing against constitutional limits even as investors show signs of discomfort.
title: Petro Seeks to Bypass Congress in Colombian Tax Hike Clash

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada is considering changes to its ban on foreign home buyers starting in 2027, its housing minister said, as the government looks for ways to increase the supply of affordable places to live.
title: Canada Weighs Opening Its Housing Market to More Foreign Capital

author: Piotr Bujnicki
description: Polish President Karol Nawrocki picked sociologist and statistician Marcin Zarzecki to join the central bank’s interest-rate setting panel.
title: Polish President Picks Zarzecki for Central Bank’s Rate Panel

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: The Republican-controlled Congress has been very good to most of corporate America this year. Foremost among the boons is a $4 trillion tax cut package that extended and added generous breaks for businesses large and small.
title: Nvidia Gains, Hospitals Hurt: Congress Winners and Losers

author: Lucy White
description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting has appeared to suggest the UK should rejoin a customs union with the European Union, opening a dividing line with Keir Starmer just weeks after he denied accusations that he was plotting a coup against the prime minister.
title: UK Minister Fuels Leadership Talk With Support for Customs Union

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The Russian war machine’s scramble to secure an unlikely component for its ammunition – cotton pulp – may have found a potential supply in Uzbekistan, where a new plant’s capacity far outstrips domestic demand.
title: Russia’s Munitions Push Sparks Scramble for Central Asian Cotton

author: Ben Sills
description: The European Union still seems overshadowed by other global powers.
title: Europe Looks Frail When It Needs to Be Strong

author: Michelle Kaske, Aaron Gordon
description: Nearly a year ago, New York City embarked on a controversial program to toll drivers entering some of Manhattan’s busiest streets. The goal of the congestion pricing plan, the first of its kind in the US, was to improve air quality and raise $15 billion to upgrade the city’s extensive — and aging  — transit system, all while relieving traffic in a routinely clogged part of town.
title: New York's Congestion Pricing Is Working. Five Charts Show How

author: Paula Sambo, Mathieu Dion
description: The flow of asylum-seekers arriving in Canada via upstate New York has plunged, a sharp reversal from the summer months when a surge of thousands of people tried to get through the Canadian border.
title: Migrants’ Dash for Canada Slows as More Are Sent Back to US

author: Moses Mozart Dzawu
description: Ghana’s parliament approved the legalization of cryptocurrency, a move to address central bank concerns about the widening and unregulated use of the alternative asset in the West African country.
title: Ghana Passes Law to Legalize Widespread Use Of Cryptocurrency

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivians enjoyed artificially cheap fuel for years. As its public finances crumble, the subsidy is coming to an end, prices are skyrocketing and drivers are striking.
title: End of Bolivia’s Cheap Fuel Era Tests New President’s Resolve

author: Ania Nussbaum, Guy Johnson, Anna Edwards
description: France’s minister for European affairs says he’s confident that Parliament will adopt a 2026 budget once negotiations resume in January.
title: France’s Haddad Confident Parliament Will Adopt Budget in 2026

description: Gold rose to an all-time high as escalating geopolitical tensions and bets on further US rate cuts added momentum to the best annual performance in more than four decades. Bloomberg’s Martin Ritchie breaks down the situation.
title: Gold Climbs to Record High Amid Geopolitical Tensions

author: Philip Glamann
description: China criticized the US for seizing oil tankers off the coast of Venezuela, signaling it stands with Caracas as its confrontation with Washington intensifies.
title: China Says US Violating Law by Seizing Oil Tankers Off Venezuela

author: Anthony Halpin
description: A senior Russian general was killed after a bomb exploded in his car in Moscow, according to investigators who pointed suspicion for the assassination at Ukraine.
title: Russian General Is Killed After Car Bomb Explodes in Moscow

description:
On today's show, gold rose to an all-time high on expectations for more Fed rate cuts. Silver and copper also climbed to records. Asian equities and US futures advanced on hopes for a year-end rally.

Oil gaining as Donald Trump intensified a blockade on Venezuela, boarding one tanker and pursuing another within weeks of first capturing a vessel. Venezuela condemned the boarding on Saturday. 

The Trump administration has defended the decision to pull several pictures from the latest release of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein. An image of a desk drawer with a number of photos, including one showing President Trump, was among those removed and then later restored. 
                                                                                            
Today's guests: Kaiko CEO Ambre Soubiran, Bruegel Non-resident Fellow Elina Ribakova & Co-Founder & General Partner Giant Ventures, Tommy Stadlen (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Pursuit of Third Oil Tanker Intensifies Venezuela Blockade | Daybreak Europe 12/22/2025

author: Rodrigo Orihuela
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez announced Monday that he is naming Elma Saiz as government spokesperson.
title: Sánchez Names Elma Saiz Spanish Government Spokeswoman

author: Hallie Gu
description: China levied tariffs on some dairy imports from the European Union — a major exporter — following an anti-subsidy probe, adding to a tit-for-tat trade dispute with the bloc.
title: China Hits EU Dairy Imports With Duties Up to 43% After Probe

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Russia said a drone attack damaged infrastructure and vessels at Volna on the Black Sea coast, yet another strike on the country’s commodities assets.
title: Drones Damage Piers and Ships at Russian Black Sea Port

description: US administration officials held “productive and constructive” meetings with Ukrainian and European counterparts in Florida, special envoy Steve Witkoff said. The talks, which are part of ongoing efforts to end the war in Ukraine, included President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, top Ukrainian negotiator Rustem Umerov and other European security advisers. Bloomberg’s Jill Disis reports.
title: US, Ukraine Had ‘Productive’ Talks, Witkoff Says

author: John Liu, Kathy Chen
description: Russia’s liquefied natural gas exports to China surged to a record in November, as buyers shrugged off the risk of western sanctions to access the cheaper fuel.
title: Russia LNG Exports to China Rise to Record, Surpassing Australia

description: The US’s pursuit of a third oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela has intensified a blockade that President Donald Trump’s administration hopes will cut off a vital economic lifeline for the country and isolate the government of President Nicolás Maduro. Bloomberg’s Stephen Stapczynski breaks down the situation and the possible impact on oil markets.
title: US Pursuit of Oil Tanker Intensifies Venezuela Blockade

author: Tracy Withers, Shruti Srivastava
description: India and New Zealand concluded a free-trade agreement, the third such pact New Delhi has reached this year even while talks with the US and European Union drag on.
title: India Wins Third Free-Trade Deal This Year With NZ Agreement

author: Cindy Wang, Philip Glamann
description: Taiwan stepped up security at transport hubs across the island after knife attacks in the capital killed three people and injured several others — a rare violent spree that shocked the democracy of 23 million people.
title: Taiwan Tightens Security After Deadly Attacks Shock the Island

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he’s nominating Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry as US special envoy to Greenland, in the latest signal that the president retains designs on increasing US influence over the island he’s suggested he wants to purchase.
title: Trump Taps Louisiana Governor Landry as Greenland Envoy

author: Ram Anand
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak lost a court bid on Monday to serve the rest of his prison term under house arrest, dealing a fresh setback to the once-powerful leader jailed over the 1MDB scandal.
title: Malaysia’s Najib Loses Bid to Serve Jail Sentence at Home

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s support ratings held steady at historically high levels according to polls conducted over the weekend, in a sign of her continued popularity despite the fallout from a dispute with China over comments she made on Taiwan last month.
title: Japanese PM Takaichi’s Support Stays Solid as China Spat Festers

author: Maya Averbuch, Eric Martin, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The US’s pursuit of a third oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela has intensified a blockade that the Trump administration hopes will cut off a vital economic lifeline for the country and isolate the government of President Nicolás Maduro.
title: US Pursuit of Third Oil Tanker Intensifies Venezuela Blockade
